intro: Schizoglossum bidens subsp. gracile, commonly known as the slender false nettle, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color, arranged in clusters. It thrives in moist, shady environments such as woodlands and stream banks. The subspecies gracile is distinguished by its smaller size and more delicate appearance compared to other subspecies of Schizoglossum bidens.
